list_definition.definition: to strike the foot against something and lose one’s balance, or nearly fall

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He stumbled over the edge of the carpet.
He stumbled along the track in the dark.

list_definition.definition: to make mistakes, or hesitate in speaking, reading aloud etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He stumbles over his words when speaking in public.

list_ex_of_english: Julian stumbles through the streets crazed with despair.
Modeling recovery from stumbles: preliminary data on variable selection and classification efficacy.
The stumbling blocks of disarming nations spring from the fears, imaginary as well as real, about defence.
Upon listening to the children read the text aloud, it was noticed that some children were hesitating and stumbling at line breaks.
Is it not conceivable that all of the actors, individual and communal, might have been stumbling, bumbling and muddling their various ways into some new order ?
One can say that they gazed at the stars and their feet stumbled on the ground.
I seemed to have stumbled on a way to gather data to generate plausible new ideas.
Very few utterances had stumbles or pauses, and these were not included in the statistical analysis.
